## Full, Freestanding General-Use R Tutorials

---

### Mainly base R tutorials

- [Cookbook for R: Basics of data cleaning, analysis and graphing](http://www.cookbook-r.com/){target="_blank"}

### Tidyverse tutorials

- [Hadley Wickham's R for Data Science online textbook](http://r4ds.had.co.nz/){target="_blank"}
- [Michael C. Frank's psychology-specific tidyverse tutorial, adapted from R for Data Science](https://github.com/mcfrank/tidyverse-tutorial/blob/master/tidyverse_tutorial.Rmd){target="_blank"}

### Syllabi for courses taught in R

You can work along with these; course materials should be linked in the syllabi.
- [Karen LaRocque's syllabus for Stanford's undergrad intro to stats in psychology class, winter 2017](http://web.stanford.edu/class/psych10/schedule/index.html){target="_blank"}
